files.description: Project overview and quickstart describing mission goals, supported workflows, installation, and how to run the planner and validation protocols.
Python package configuration defining dependencies, entry points, tooling, and test settings for the workflow/provenance planning toolkit.
Package initializer exporting public interfaces for schemas, heuristics, and the plan generator.
Pydantic data models and JSON Schema exporters for metadata fields covering edition/translation provenance, page/paragraph variants, and repository citations.
Deterministic, lightweight detection heuristics for inferring provenance signals from citations, filenames, OCR text, and repository metadata.
Structured, testable checklist specifications for authors, archivists, and journals including required metadata, validation rules, and escalation paths.
Machine-readable UI/UX requirement specs for plugins and submission systems including forms, defaults, error states, and reviewer-facing displays.
Empirical evaluation protocol generator detailing survey instruments, audit-study designs, sampling plans, outcome metrics, and analysis templates.
Prioritized task breakdown generator that composes checklists, schema, UI/UX requirements, heuristics, and evaluation protocols into a concrete, handoff-ready plan.
Command-line interface to output the complete prioritized mission plan as JSON/Markdown and to export schemas and protocol documents for partners.
End-to-end tests validating schema correctness, heuristic determinism, and that generated plans include required sections, priorities, and protocol components.
Directory containing small sample citation strings, OCR snippets, and repository metadata fixtures used by tests and demo runs.

missionDescription: Design a concrete, testable plan for developing and validating community-endorsed workflows and lightweight software/plugins that detect edition/translation provenance, variant page/paragraph numbers, and public-domain repository citations for primary-source scholarship in psychology. Produce a prioritized task breakdown (specs for checklists, metadata schema, UI/UX requirements, automated detection heuristics, and an empirical evaluation protocol including survey and audit-study designs) that can be handed to developers, archivists, and journal partners.
missionSuccessCriteria: Detailed specification document (1â€“2 pages) listing: checklist items, required metadata fields (with controlled vocabularies and provenance tags), and data model mappings to common formats (BibTeX, CSL-JSON, TEI).

Technical requirements and heuristics: clear algorithmic rules/heuristics for flagging edition/translation provenance, mapping variant page/paragraph numbers, and detecting public-domain repository citations, plus prioritized list of three lightweight plugin architectures (e.g., browser extension, Zotero plugin, Pandoc filter) with API/format inputs and outputs.

Empirical evaluation protocol: survey instruments (target populations, sample sizes, key measures), audit-study plan (sampling frame, coding scheme, interrater reliability targets), and statistical analysis plan with primary outcomes (citation accuracy, reproducibility rate, perceived ease) and success thresholds.

Implementation-ready workplan: prioritized milestones, required roles (developer, historian/archivist, UX researcher), estimated resource/time per milestone, and a risk/mitigation table for common archival and legal issues.
